column3: Let's slow down please and let the review part to catch you... thx\n
Where is this deprecated? I prefer the current form... :/

I don't like C++ style casts for simple integer types. Sure, C-style casts can be dangerous in general, but for simple types there is no such risk, and result in much less cluttered notation.\n\n<sub>I do prefer `(int)a` over `int(a)`, though.</sub>
Our style guide does not mention what is preferred and it does not seem relevant, so tend to NACK.
Closing since consensus seems to be that this change is unnecessary :-)\n
